main event: A round silver object, the size of a match head, was observed traveling in a northerly direction over Oklahoma City on May 29, 1956.
interesting points: The object was seen passing overhead twice, once heading south and then north before fading away., The sighting lasted for a total duration of two hours and five minutes., The object was reported as being silver in color., There were no photographs taken of the sighting., The investigation was conducted by the Air Force.
witness description: Civilian observations were made but no specific witnesses are confirmed.
